Package nzilbb.labbcat.server.db

Class SqlGraphStoreAdministration

  • Object
    • SqlGraphStore
      • SqlGraphStoreAdministration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GraphStore, GraphStoreAdministration, GraphStoreQuery
    public class SqlGraphStoreAdministration
extends SqlGraphStore
implements GraphStoreAdministration
    Graph store administration that uses a relational database as its back end.
    Author:
    Robert Fromont robert@fromont.net.nz

        password - The databa password.
        storeUser - ID of the user

      • newAnnotatorTask

        public void newAnnotatorTask​(String annotatorId,
                             String taskId,
                             String description)
                      throws StoreException,
                             PermissionException
        Create a new annotator task with the given ID and description.
        Parameters:
        annotatorId - The ID of the annotator that will perform the task.
        taskId - The ID of the task, which must not already exist.
        description - The description of the task.
        Throws:
        StoreException - If an error prevents the operation.
        PermissionException - If the operation is not permitted.

                                           throws StoreException,
                                                  PermissionException
        Supplies a list of automation tasks for the identified annotator.
        Parameters:
        annotatorId - The ID of the annotator.
        Returns:
        A map of task IDs to descriptions.
        Throws:
        StoreException - If an error prevents the operation.
        PermissionException - If the operation is not permitted.

      • getAnnotatorTaskParameters

        public String getAnnotatorTaskParameters​(String taskId)
                                  throws StoreException,
                                         PermissionException
        Supplies the given task's parameter string.
        Parameters:
        taskId - The ID of the automation task.
        Returns:
        The task parameters, serialized as a string, or null if the taskId does not exist.
        Throws:
        StoreException - If an error prevents the operation.
        PermissionException - If the operation is not permitted.
